result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (5th+ Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael D. Mayer was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: IID requirement applies to all vehicles which are registered in your name and any vehicles you operate.  During your IID requirement period, you may not operate any motor vehicle without an IID installed.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant shall maintain full time employment.  Should defendant become unemployed he shall apply at 30 businesses/month that are hiring and file work search affidavits.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Undertake AODA assessment and  comply with treatment recommendations.  Pay supervisory fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

timeConds.notes: consecutive with good time. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations. Court grants GPS. Defendant taken into custody and transported to the Winnebago County Jail. GPS authorized by the court if arrangments can be made. Transfer authorized.
